posts.author: Toben Archer
posts.message:
So the note selector had this weird lagging issue. Its been bothering me for weeks now but I've not been able to pin it down. I'm going to have to do something similar for line editors so I had to figure it out. And I did. The state value that I had put in that component was what was causing the problem. I removed it so it is now stateless and depends entirely on it's parent object and it works now. Thank goodness.

I fear performance issues. It takes nearly a second for everything to propagate back and forth. This is acceptable for now, but I will probably need to revisit this and find a way to improve performance.
posts.title: State values were what was screwing me up.

That should be sufficently ridged and flexible to allow me to do what I need and still save the files in a human readable format.

posts.author: Toben Archer
posts.message: I have seen the error in my ways! so to speak. I've done things this way at work in Vue. Note and Gatra shouldn't be holding their own internal state like I'm currently doing. Rather they communicate up the stack that a change has occured and the master data structure at the top gets updated then the change perculates back down. The advantage to this is that the top level data structure is always right. Makes things like loading and saving much easier.
